definition: U or u is the twenty-first letter of the English alphabet

senses.definition: ' If a situation is ugly, it seems that there could be trouble or even violence.
example: That building should never have been passed by the council[j4]it's so ugly. [j33] I always felt that I was hideously ugly. [j33] My neck came out in an ugly rash
The crowd was in an ugly mood. [j33] Things were growing ugly, and I wished I'd stayed away. [j33] In an ugly development, children as young as ten have taken to carrying knives

The crowd was in an ugly mood. [j33] Things were growing ugly, and I wished I'd stayed away. [j33] In an ugly development, children as young as ten have taken to carrying knives

definition: An ulcer is a sore on the outside or the inside of your body which bleeds and forms pus.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective ulcerated'
example: The ulcers on his legs need to be dressed regularly. [j33] She's got a stomach ulcer

senses.definition: ' Ultimate also means the most extreme possible case of something.
example: My ultimate aim is to become a director of the company
To climb all the mountains in the Himalayas is the ultimate challenge
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb ultimately' Ultimately I'd like to buy a house near the beach.

senses.definition: ' Ultimate also means the most extreme possible case of something.
example: My ultimate aim is to become a director of the company
To climb all the mountains in the Himalayas is the ultimate challenge
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb ultimately' Ultimately I'd like to buy a house near the beach.

definition: Um is used to represent the sound that people make when they hesitate in speaking.
rest: C@u:ld y@u: c@mE nExt wEEk, u:m, sa:y @n thE 24th?
example: He's, um, rather a difficult character

definition: You use an umbrella to protect yourself against the rain
example: It consists of a long handle attached to a folding metal frame covered in cloth

definition: An umpire is the person who makes sure that a game such as tennis or cricket is played according to the rules
note: ... A SIMILAR WORD is referee.  [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'verb umpire' Who's umpiring the match?

definition: In infor~ mal language, umpteen means very many.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective umpteenth' I couldn't face starting again for the umpteenth time.
example: Poor Hilda, she's had umpteen attempts at getting her driver's licence but she keeps on failing

definition: If a decision is unanimous, everyone involved agrees that is what should be done.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb unanimously' They voted unanimously to re-elect her as chair.
example: The vote was unanimous. [j33] We were unanimous that we should wait another month

definition: If something is uncanny, it is so strange that it makes you think that it may be caused by something outside the natural world.
example: Kimiko has an uncanny ability to pick who is the next person to marry. [j33] By an uncanny coincidence, he phoned just as I was talking about him. [j33] The similarity between them is uncanny

senses.definition: ' Your uncle is the brother of your father or mother
example: ' Your uncle is also the husband of your aunt

senses.definition: ' Your uncle is the brother of your father or mother
example: ' Your uncle is also the husband of your aunt

senses.definition: ' If you are unconscious of something, you are not aware of it.
example: He was found unconscious on the street. [j33] She struck her head against the wall and was knocked unconscious
Nina continued to read, completely unconscious of the fact that everyone in the room was staring at her
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb unconsciously' I fear that I may have unconsciously offended some of the guests.[j35] 'noun unconsciousness' The patient lapsed into unconsciousness.

senses.definition: ' If you are unconscious of something, you are not aware of it.
example: He was found unconscious on the street. [j33] She struck her head against the wall and was knocked unconscious
Nina continued to read, completely unconscious of the fact that everyone in the room was staring at her
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb unconsciously' I fear that I may have unconsciously offended some of the guests.[j35] 'noun unconsciousness' The patient lapsed into unconsciousness.

senses.definition: 'If something takes place under' certain conditions or circumstances, it happens with those conditions affecting it or allowing it to take place.
example: He keeps his tennis racquet under his bed
We have the picture hanging on the wall directly under the spotlight
Children under 18 are not permitted to buy cigarettes or alcohol
We can only employ him under the conditions stated in his contract

definition: If you bowl under~ arm, you throw the ball with your arm in a position below the level of your shoulder
If food is under~ done, it has not been cooked long enough

comment: verb forms undergoes, underwent, undergone, undergoing
definition: If you undergo something unpleasant or difficult, you experience it.  It happens to you.
example: The patient underwent three operations in four days. [j33] The witness underwent hostile questioning. [j33] The appa~ ratus is undergoing tests

definition: Undergrowth is bushes and other small plants that grow close together under trees.
example: We had to clear a lot of undergrowth in the backyard of our new house

definition: If someone is underhand, they are sly and secretive in the way they do things.
example: There's nothing underhand about Julie[j4]she really lets you know what she thinks! [j33] It was pretty underhand of him to go above me to my boss

senses.definition: ' If you underline something that you say, you emphasise it.
example: The teacher told us to underline any words that we didn't know and look them up in a dictionary. [j33] The word 'urgent' was underlined twice in red
Let me underline that this must not happen again. [j33] Dentists underline the importance of regular brushing of the teeth. [j33] This incident underlines the necessity for regular fire drills

senses.definition: ' If something is underneath something else, it is below or beneath it.  2 ' '
example: noun The underneath of something such as a table or chair is the part that is closest to the ground and faces the ground.  [cf2]Don't bother painting the underneath of the table[j4]it'll never be seen

definition: Underpants are a short piece of clothing worn by men and boys under trousers or shorts

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say you understand something is the case, you mean that you have heard it or take it to be true.
example: Do you understand these maths formulae? [j33] I don't understand what she wants us to do
She spoke so fast that I couldn't understand her

I understand Italian but I can't speak it very well. [j33] I don't understand the word 'symptom'.   4 ' '[cf2]verb If you understand someone or something, you are aware of their nature and why they behave in a certain way.  [cf2]Teenagers often claim that their parents don't understand them. [j33] I can't understand what made her do it. [j33] I knew I could count on you to understand
I understand you've not been well, Mr Gresham. [j33] I understand they're in financial difficulties
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective understandable' The delay is understandable in view of the circumstances.[j35] 'noun understanding' She has a good understanding of the issues.  He nodded in understanding.

definition: If you understate something, you present it as being smaller or less important than it really is.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun understatement' To call it unfortunate would be an understatement.
example: It is an offence to understate your income for tax purposes. [j33] If anything, he has understated the problem

comment: verb forms undertakes, undertook, undertaken, undertaking

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you undertake to do something, you promise that you will do it.
example: In the interim I will undertake the role of acting manager
She undertook to repay her creditors
note: [j34] ... WORD FAMILY 'noun undertaking' He gave me his undertaking it would be done.

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you undertake to do something, you promise that you will do it.
example: In the interim I will undertake the role of acting manager
She undertook to repay her creditors
note: [j34] ... WORD FAMILY 'noun undertaking' He gave me his undertaking it would be done.

definition: An undertaker is someone whose job is to prepare the bodies of dead people for burial or cremation
example: They supply the coffin and make arrangements for the funeral

definition: Underwear is cloth~ ing such as pants, bras, singlets and petticoats which you wear under your other clothes

comment: verb forms undoes, undid, undone, undoing

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say something undoes someone, you mean it causes their downfall.
example: He undid his seat belt and stepped out of the car. [j33] I can't undo this zip. [j33] Can you help me undo the knots? [j33] She undid the top button on her blouse
The psychiatrist is trying to undo the emotional damage that Ben suffered in childhood
His addiction to gambling eventually undid him
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun undoing' This small care~ lessness proved to be her undoing.

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say something undoes someone, you mean it causes their downfall.

definition: If you are uneasy about something, you feel anxious and worried about it.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun unease' I felt a sense of unease at these developments.
example: I felt uneasy about lying to my mother. [j33] I'm beginning to get uneasy about the delay

definition: 'If you are unemployed, you do not have a job
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun unemployed' The government announced a new initiative to help the unemployed.[j35] 'noun unemployment'

definition: An uneventful period of time has no important or interesting things happening in it.
example: Our holiday was a little boring and uneventful

definition: If some~ thing is unforgettable, it makes such a strong impression on you that you will never forget it.
example: The scenery was absolutely breathtaking[j4]quite unforgettable. [j33] Thank you all so much for making my stay unforgettable

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say that things are uniform, you mean that they are the same.  They don't vary.
example: Julio looks so handsome in his naval uniform. [j33] I walked past three girls in school uniform
The results were surprisingly uniform across the whole population tested. [j33] Along the wall was a set of uniform glass jars

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say that things are uniform, you mean that they are the same.  They don't vary.
example: Julio looks so handsome in his naval uniform. [j33] I walked past three girls in school uniform
The results were surprisingly uniform across the whole population tested. [j33] Along the wall was a set of uniform glass jars

definition: If you unify several things, you bring them together as one thing.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun unification'
example: We are trying to unify the accounts of the various witnesses to give us an overall picture of what happened. [j33] The sales and marketing departments will be unified in the new building

definition: 'times,0'[cp8
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb unilaterally' He unilaterally decided to end the contract.
example: 5]juni[j24]l[j12]t[j17]r[j17]l, -[j24]l[j12]tr[j17]l, jun[j17]-' A unilateral decision or action is taken by only one of the parties involved with a particular issue, without consulting the others

definition: If you are uninterested in something, you are not interested in it and you don't want to know about it.
note: ... DO NOT CONFUSE this word with disinterested.  [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective uninteresting' The meeting was more than usually uninteresting.
example: I am completely uninterested in their problems

definition: A union or trade union is an organisation of workers in a particular industry or group of industries which tries to improve pay and conditions for its members
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective union' ...a union member.  ...union dues.

definition: If something is unique, it is very special and rare.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb uniquely' She is uniquely well qualified to take on the task.
example: Be very careful not to chip this vase[j4]it's unique. [j33] She has a unique combination of talents for the job

definition: If something is unisex, it is suitable for both men and women.
example: 'Is this jumper for a man or a woman?'  'Either, it's unisex

senses.definition: ' If a group of people do something in unison, they all do it together.
example: We all shouted 'Happy Birthday' in unison. [j33] When their demands weren't met they left the room in unison

senses.definition: ' If a group of people do something in unison, they all do it together.
example: We all shouted 'Happy Birthday' in unison. [j33] When their demands weren't met they left the room in unison

senses.definition: ' A unit or home unit is a set of rooms for a family to live in.  Other words you can use for this are flat or apartment.
example: Our family is a close and supportive unit. [j33] I've completed the first three units of my course. [j33] You can buy the shelving in separate units and fit them together
In Australia we use metric units, but in the United States imperial units are used
Tony and Isabella rented for about a year and then bought a unit in Brisbane

definition: If two or more people unite, they join together in order to achieve something.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective united' We are united on this issue.
example: Despite their differences, they united to oppose the planning application

definition: If something is universal, it relates to everybody or everything.
rest: H@w u:ni:vErsa:l i:s thi:s pr@blEm? Ha:s a:ny@nE ElsE ha:d tr@u:blE?
example: There was universal sympathy for his predicament. [j33] Crime is a universal problem[j4]it's not confined to particular suburbs

definition: The universe is every~ thing that exists.
example: Many people believe that the universe must have been created by a divine being. [j33] Somewhere in the universe there may be other intelligent beings. [j33] Her whole universe had collapsed

definition: A university is a place of higher education where students study for degrees and research is carried out by postgraduate students, lecturers and professors.
note: [j34] ... A SHORTENED FORM of this, used in informal language, is uni.  [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective university' ...a university course.  ...a university degree.
example: Shirin hopes to go to university. [j33] He graduated from university last year

definition: If a person or thing is unknown, people do not know who or what they are, or they do not know about them.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun unknown' Fear of the unknown can be a barrier to progress.
example: The security guard stopped the unknown man at the door. [j33] Thai cooking ingredients are still unknown to many Australians

definition: In rather formal language, unlawful means 'not legal'

'times,0'[cp8.5]... n[j24]les, [j17]n-' Unless means 'if ...not'.  If you say that something will happen unless another thing does, you mean that the first thing will happen if the another thing does not.
example: I'll leave at eight unless I hear from you. [j33] I won't go unless he asks me to. [j33] Don't open the door unless you're sure it's me

senses.definition: b' If you unravel a complicated situation, you work out what the situation is and get it clear.
example: I had to stop and unravel the wool before I could get on with my knitting

It took me some time to unravel what she was talking about. [j33] When he died we had a lot of paperwork to unravel. 2 ' '[cf2]verb If something that is knitted unravels, it comes apart because the thread is broken.  [cf2]The sleeve is unravelling all around the moth hole. [j33] She felt as though her life was unravelling

example: I had to stop and unravel the wool before I could get on with my knitting

senses.definition: ' In informal language, if you say something is unreal, you mean that it is fantastic or amazing.
example: Everything happened so quickly that it all seemed unreal. [j33] Her death felt quite unreal to me until the day of the funeral
'How was the movie?'  'Unreal!' [j33] They serve this unreal chocolate ice-cream

senses.definition: ' In informal language, if you say something is unreal, you mean that it is fantastic or amazing.
example: Everything happened so quickly that it all seemed unreal. [j33] Her death felt quite unreal to me until the day of the funeral
'How was the movie?'  'Unreal!' [j33] They serve this unreal chocolate ice-cream

definition: Unrest is discontent among a body of people that may lead to trouble or even violence.
example: The rioting is over but there's still a mood of unrest. [j33] Industrial unrest has lost millions of dollars in production

definition: If you survive an accident or a bad experience unscathed, you are not injured or harmed by it.
example: The car was a write- off, but amazingly the driver was unscathed. [j33] Fatima's had a rotten life, and yet she appears to have come through unscathed

senses.definition: ' If you unscrew something from somewhere, you detach it by removing the screws that are holding it in place.  You usually do this with a screwdriver.
example: Could you unscrew this lid for me?  It's a bit tight
I unscrewed the mirror from the wall and put up a print in its place

senses.definition: ' If you unscrew something from somewhere, you detach it by removing the screws that are holding it in place.  You usually do this with a screwdriver.
example: Could you unscrew this lid for me?  It's a bit tight
I unscrewed the mirror from the wall and put up a print in its place

definition: Someone who is unscrupulous doesn't behave according to moral principles.  They often act dishonestly.
example: Some unscrupulous car dealers were selling stolen vehicles

definition: If something unsettles you, it disturbs you and makes you anxious or worried.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective unsettled' I've been feeling nervous and unsettled lately.[j35]'adjective unsettling' I found the trial an unsettling experience.
example: I rejoined the party, but the telephone call had unsettled me

definition: If you untangle some~ thing that is twisted or difficult, you untie the knots or twisted parts in it or you remove the difficulties from it.
example: Jan carefully untangled all the wires at the back of the video. [j33] The accountant spent hours untangling his client's financial affairs

senses.definition: ' If something is unthinkable, you can't imagine it ever happening.
example: If the nuclear waste leaked out, the consequences would be unthinkable
Julie is totally honest[j4]it's unthinkable that she could be the thief

senses.definition: ' If something is unthinkable, you can't imagine it ever happening.
example: If the nuclear waste leaked out, the consequences would be unthinkable
Julie is totally honest[j4]it's unthinkable that she could be the thief

senses.definition: ' If you untie something, you release it by removing the string or cord that is holding it in place.
example: You must untie your laces before you take off your shoes
After the robbers left he managed to untie himself and phone for help

definition: If something is unusual, it is rare.  It does not happen very often or you do not find it very often.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb unusually' We've had an unusually warm winter this year.  He was unusually late for work.
example: Earthquakes are quite unusual in Australia. [j33] It's unusual to find koalas so close to the city. [j33] The soup had an unusual taste to it. [j33] She likes unusual jewellery

definition: If something is unwieldy, it is difficult to move or handle because of its size, weight or shape.
example: The painting isn't particularly heavy, but it's unwieldy. [j33] The volumes of maps are large and unwieldy

senses.definition: ' ups and downs'  Ups and downs are the mixture of the good and bad things that happen.
example: The hikers slowly made their way up the mountain
She looked after her sick husband right up to his death. '   (b) '[cf2] If someone is up to something, they are secretly doing something they shouldn't be doing
Trent's broke now but he used to be a millionaire[j4]he's certainly had his share of ups and downs

Trent's broke now but he used to be a millionaire[j4]he's certainly had his share of ups and downs

definition: Your upbringing is the way you were brought up.  It is the way you were taught and treated during your childhood.
example: He had an unusual upbringing on an isolated station

definition: If you update something, you bring it up to date.  You change it according to the way things are now.
example: The information in this file needs updating[j4]a lot of the addresses are no longer current. [j33] She decided it was time to update her image. [j33] Let me update you on what's happened

definition: If you upgrade something such as an appliance, you get a new one that has more features
example: Sometimes you can get a discount if you buy it from the same manufacturer as the old one

definition: An upheaval is a move from one place or job to another which causes a lot of disruption and inconvenience.
example: We took six months to settle down after the upheaval of moving from Europe to Australia

senses.definition: ' If something moves uphill, it is going up towards the top of a hill or slope.
example: It's very tiring running uphill
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downhill.   2' 'adjective An uphill task is a very hard and difficult one.  It will be uphill work getting the job finished by tomorrow.

definition: In formal language, to uphold something means to support or maintain it.
example: The Supreme Court upheld the decision of the lower court. [j33] We must uphold the rule of law

definition: Upholstery is the soft covering on chairs, lounges and sofas which makes them comfortable to sit on.  It consists of stuffing covered with fabric.
note: [j34] ... WORD FAMILY 'verb upholster' The sofa was upholstered in blue velvet.
example: This fabric is suitable for upholstery, but it's too coarse for dressmaking

definition: The upkeep of something such as a house or car is its maintenance.  It is what you have to do to keep it in good condition and how much this costs.
example: It was quite a bargain to buy, but the upkeep has been very expensive

definition: 'times,0'[cp8.5][j24]... p-mak[j17]t' If something is up-market, it is of superior quality and expensive.
example: To celebrate, they decided to go out to an up-market restaurant

definition: Upon is a formal word for on

senses.definition: ' If something is described as upper, it is above or higher than something else.
example: He lives in an apartment block on one of the upper floors. [j33] She had a large swelling on her upper lip
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is lower.   2 ' have the upper hand'  ' If you have the upper hand in a situation, you are in a strong or dominant position.  In the first half our opponents had the upper hand, but now we're beginning to fight back.

senses.definition: ' If something is uppermost in your mind, it is what you are thinking about as the most important thing.
example: There is still some snow on the uppermost slopes of the mountain
As the truck skidded out of control, what was uppermost in Theo's mind was to try to avoid the oncoming car

senses.definition: ' If something is uppermost in your mind, it is what you are thinking about as the most important thing.
example: There is still some snow on the uppermost slopes of the mountain
As the truck skidded out of control, what was uppermost in Theo's mind was to try to avoid the oncoming car

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say someone is upright, you mean that they are honest and honourable.
example: Try to keep the bottle upright as the seal isn't very tight. [j33] At last we got the boat upright again
Henry's always been an upright citizen[j4]I can't believe he'd be guilty of fraud

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say someone is upright, you mean that they are honest and honourable.
example: Try to keep the bottle upright as the seal isn't very tight. [j33] At last we got the boat upright again
Henry's always been an upright citizen[j4]I can't believe he'd be guilty of fraud

definition: An uprising occurs when a large group of people rebel against their government
note: ... SIMILAR WORDS to this are rebellion and revolt.

definition: An uproar is the loud noise and shouting that a group of people make when they are very angry about something.
example: The meeting ended in total uproar. [j33] I went out to see what all the uproar in the street was about. [j33] There was an uproar when the results were announced

definition: If something is uproarious, it is very funny.
example: I really recommend the movie[j4]it's uproarious. [j33] He told us some uproarious stories about his adventures in Europe

definition: 1 ' If something upsets you, it causes you to feel unhappy or worried.  It distresses you.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective upset' What's the matter with Michaela?  She seems very upset.[j35]'adjective upsetting' It was a very upsetting experience for the whole family.
example: The news of Wang's arrival has upset everybody.  2 ' '[cf2]verb If something upsets your plans, it makes it impossible for you to go ahead as you had intended. [cf2]The storm upset our plans to go to the beach. [j33] This delay has upset our whole schedule.  3 ' '[cf2]verb If something such as food or drink upsets you, it makes you feel sick.  [cf2]All that rich food last night upset my stomach. [j33] I'm allergic to fish[j4]the smallest amount upsets me for days

definition: If some~ thing is upside down, it is the wrong way up. The part that is usually or meant to be at the top is at the bottom, and the part that is usually or meant to be at the bottom is at the top.
example: You've hung the picture upside down. [j33] You have to put the pages into the copier upside down. [j33] I turned each card upside down as I dealt with it

definition: If you go upstairs in a building, you go up to a higher floor than the one you are on.
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downstairs.  [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective upstairs  'times,0'[cp8.5][j24]... pste[j17]z' ' ...the upstairs bathroom.
example: I went upstairs to fetch my glasses. [j33] 'Where's Judy?'  'She's upstairs in her bedroom

senses.definition: ' If something is upstream of something else along a river, it is closer to the source.
example: We rowed a little further upstream
The old mill is a few kilometres upstream of the bridge. [j33] They complained about the pollution being discharged by the factories upstream
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downstream.

senses.definition: ' If something is upstream of something else along a river, it is closer to the source.
example: We rowed a little further upstream
The old mill is a few kilometres upstream of the bridge. [j33] They complained about the pollution being discharged by the factories upstream
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downstream.

definition: In informal language, if you say someone is uptight, you mean that they are very tense and anxious about something.
example: Stefan should learn to relax[j4]he's always so uptight. [j33] There's no point getting uptight about it[j4]it's really no concern of yours

senses.definition: ' If something is up-to-date, it is current and includes all the latest developments.
example: Are all these files up-to-date? [j33] Have you got an up-to-date address for Carrie? 2 ' '[cf2]adjective If something is up-to-date, it is modern. It is fashionable or uses the latest technology.  [cf2]You should get rid of this old suit and get something more up-to-date. [j33] I want one of those up-to-date cameras with all the extra features

definition: An upturn is an improve~ ment in the condition of something.
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downturn.
example: In the last few months there has been a gradual upturn in the economy. [j33] We've experienced an upturn in our fortunes since we moved north

definition: An upward movement goes from a lower place or condition to a higher one.
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downward.
example: We passed the other cable car on its upward journey. [j33] There has been an upward trend in property prices

senses.definition: ' If something moves upwards, it goes from a lower place or condition to a higher one.
example: Suddenly the lift shot upwards. [j33] The temperature crept steadily upwards as we drove north
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downwards.   2 upwards of' ' Upwards of  a number or an amount means more than that number or amount.  Upwards of thirty people came to the party.  The paintings are priced at $200 and upwards.

senses.definition: ' If something is upwind of something else, the wind is blowing in the direction from the first thing to the second.
example: We tacked upwind to the island
The animal seemed to detect a predator upwind
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downwind.

senses.definition: ' If something is upwind of something else, the wind is blowing in the direction from the first thing to the second.
example: We tacked upwind to the island
The animal seemed to detect a predator upwind
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is downwind.

definition: Uranium is a radio~ active element
example: It is used to produce nuclear energy and nuclear weapons

definition: Urban means relating to a city or town.
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is rural.
example: I longed to escape from urban life

definition: If someone is urbane, they are charming and sophisticated.
example: His urbane manner made him a welcome guest

senses.definition: ' If you urge someone to do something, you try hard to persuade them to do it.
example: I felt a powerful urge to ring her. [j33] I resisted the urge to strike him
I urged Arturo to think carefully before giving up his job

senses.definition: ' If you urge someone to do something, you try hard to persuade them to do it.
example: I felt a powerful urge to ring her. [j33] I resisted the urge to strike him
I urged Arturo to think carefully before giving up his job

definition: 'If something is urgent, it must be dealt with as soon as possible.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun urgency' This is now a matter of urgency.  There was urgency in her voice.[j35]'adverb urgently' You're wanted urgently on the phone.   I'm afraid I must go home urgently.
example: The letter was stamped 'URGENT'. [j33] I must speak with Mr Tanaka on an urgent matter. [j33] Please ask Bridget to call me as soon as she get's in[j4]it's urgent

definition: A urinal is a type of toilet for men to urinate in
'times,0'[cp8
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb urinate' I felt an urgent need to urinate.[j35]'noun urination' I suffer from severe pain on urination.
example: 5][j24]jur[j17]n, -a[j11]n'  Urine is the waste liquid that you pass out of your body at intervals

senses.definition: ' An urn is a large electric container used for boiling water to make tea or coffee for a large number of people
example: ' An urn is also a kind of vase.  It is often used to contain the ashes of dead people who have been cremated

senses.definition: ' An urn is a large electric container used for boiling water to make tea or coffee for a large number of people
example: ' An urn is also a kind of vase.  It is often used to contain the ashes of dead people who have been cremated

definition: Us is the form of we that is used as the object of a verb or after a preposition.
rest: Tha:t ma:n i:s p@i:nti:ng a:t u:s!
example: Our teacher gives us too much homework

senses.definition: ' use up'  If you use up a supply of something, you use all of it so that there is none left.
example: Who's used up all the toilet paper? [j33] Don't use up all the hot water[j4]I want a shower too
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective usable (<or> useable)' The knife is so blunt that it's no longer usable.[j35]'adjective useful' Thanks for lending me the book on gardening[j4]it was very useful.[j35]'noun usefulness' [j35]'adjective useless' It's useless expecting them to help.   Her advice was useless to me.[j35]'noun user' The new model is very popular with users.

senses.definition: ' use up'  If you use up a supply of something, you use all of it so that there is none left.
example: Who's used up all the toilet paper? [j33] Don't use up all the hot water[j4]I want a shower too
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective usable (<or> useable)' The knife is so blunt that it's no longer usable.[j35]'adjective useful' Thanks for lending me the book on gardening[j4]it was very useful.[j35]'noun usefulness' [j35]'adjective useless' It's useless expecting them to help.   Her advice was useless to me.[j35]'noun user' The new model is very popular with users.

senses.definition: ' If you are used to something, you are familiar with it.  It isn't a surprise or a shock to you.
example: Don't take any notice of Tren's tantrums[j4]you'll get used to them. [j33] It took me quite a while to get used to the climate. [j33] I'm not used to having to wear a suit to work
' If something such as a car is described as used, it is second-hand

senses.definition: ' If you are used to something, you are familiar with it.  It isn't a surprise or a shock to you.
example: Don't take any notice of Tren's tantrums[j4]you'll get used to them. [j33] It took me quite a while to get used to the climate. [j33] I'm not used to having to wear a suit to work
' If something such as a car is described as used, it is second-hand

senses.definition: ' as usual'  If you say that something happens as usual, you mean that it normally happens that way.  There is nothing different or surprising about it.
example: Today I got up earlier than my usual time. [j33] I felt bored with my usual activities. [j33] The usual way is to pay quarterly. [j33] I was even hungrier than usual
I left for work at seven as usual, but the traffic was so bad I didn't arrive until eight
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb usually' I usually go to the shops on Saturday.   It's not usually so warm in July.

senses.definition: ' as usual'  If you say that something happens as usual, you mean that it normally happens that way.  There is nothing different or surprising about it.

note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb usually' I usually go to the shops on Saturday.   It's not usually so warm in July.

definition: [cf2]noun Ute' is a short form of utility truck'
Utensils are things that you use when you are doing tasks in your home such as cooking.  Note that this word is usually used in the plural form.
example: You can be more efficient if you've got good kitchen utensils

definition: Uterus is a formal word for the womb
<noun Utilities' are resources, such as gas and electricity, supplied to consumers by public or private enterprises
<noun> A utility truck' is a vehicle with an enclosed front for a driver and passenger, and a bigger back for carrying things
example: The back can be covered by a tarpaulin or uncovered

senses.definition: ' In rather formal language, if you say someone utters sounds or words, you mean that they express them with their voice.
example: To my utter amazement, I passed the maths test. [j33] She looked at me in utter disbelief. [j33] The whole trip was an utter disaster
Marnie uttered a scream. [j33] The words were uttered in a whisper. [j33] He promised not to utter a word about the plan. [j33] She uttered the opinion that it was a lot of fuss about nothing
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb utterly' He seemed utterly astonished by the news.
